unnormalised: ## Flying High (or Not): My Adventures with Indian Airways
normalised: ## Flying High (or Not): My Adventures with Indian Airways

unnormalised: Okay, so you’re thinking of flying within India? Great choice! India is amazing! But before you book that flight, let me, your friendly neighbourhood travel guru (who’s learned a *lot* the hard way), share some insights on Indian Airways. Buckle up, because this is going to be a bumpy ride (pun intended, naturally).
normalised: Okay, so you’re thinking of flying within India? Great choice! India is amazing! But before you book that flight, let me, your friendly neighborhood travel guru (who’s learned a lot the hard way), share some insights on Indian Airways. Buckle up, because this is going to be a bumpy ride (pun intended, naturally).

unnormalised: First things first: booking. Ah, the joy of navigating websites that look like they were designed in 1998. Pro-tip: book *way* in advance. Like, seriously, if you’re planning a trip for Diwali on 01/11, book it now. No, seriously, stop reading and book it now! Otherwise, you’ll be paying Rs. 20,000 for a one-way ticket or, worse, stuck in your in-laws’ house for an extra week. Trust me, that’s a fate worse than turbulence.

Like, seriously, if you’re planning a trip for Diwali on first november, book it now. No, seriously, stop reading and book it now! Otherwise, you’ll be paying rupee twenty thousand for a one-way ticket or, worse, stuck in your in-laws’ house for an extra week. Trust me, that’s a fate worse than turbulence.

unnormalised: Then comes the check-in. Online check-in? Sure, it *exists*. But will it work? Maybe. Will your seat actually be the one you selected? Probably not. I once “pre-booked” a window seat only to find myself sandwiched between a snoring uncle and a baby who thought my armrest was a teething toy. Good times! Allow at least 2 hrs at the airport, esp at DEL or BOM. You'll need it.

Allow at least two hours at the airport, especially at D-E-L or B-O-M. You'll need it.

unnormalised: Security. Ah, security. Where every electronic device is a potential bomb, and your bottle of water is public enemy number one. Remember, no liquids over 100 ml. Even if it’s holy Ganga Jal. They’re very strict. And don't even *think* about arguing with the CISF personnel. They've heard it all before.

Even if it’s holy Ganga Jal. They’re very strict. And don't even think about arguing with the C-I-S-F personnel. They've heard it all before.

unnormalised: Now, the flight itself. Legroom? What legroom? Unless you’re built like a hobbit, prepare to contort yourself into positions you didn’t know were possible. And if you happen to be on a budget airline, be prepared to pay for everything. Like, even air. Okay, I’m exaggerating. But not by much. You might get a complimentary glass of water or maybe a biscuit, but that’s about it. Upgrade to Air India if you value your knees.

unnormalised: Food. Airline food. Enough said. But seriously, pack your own snacks. Because even if you pre-ordered that gourmet meal (for an extra Rs. 500, mind you), there’s a 50/50 chance they’ll have “forgotten” to load it. Or they'll give you something totally different. One time, I ordered a vegetarian meal and got chicken. Chicken! The horror! Thank goodness for my emergency stash of Parle-G biscuits.

Or they'll give you something totally different. One time, I ordered a vegetarian meal and got chicken. Chicken! The horror! Thank goodness for my emergency stash of Parle-G biscuits.

unnormalised: Delays. Oh, the delays! Flights are delayed for reasons that range from mildly plausible to utterly absurd. "Operational reasons" is the catch-all phrase they use. Don't be surprised if your flight is delayed by 3 hrs or more. Always check the flight status before you leave for the airport. And remember, patience is a virtue. Or at least a coping mechanism.

unnormalised: But despite all the chaos, the questionable food, and the existential dread of delayed flights, there’s something undeniably charming about flying Indian Airways. Maybe it’s the sheer absurdity of it all. Maybe it's the fact that you’ll inevitably have a story to tell. Or maybe it's just the relief of finally reaching your destination in one piece. Whatever it is, flying Indian Airways is an experience you won't soon forget. Just remember to pack your snacks, your patience, and maybe a good book. And try to find the humour in it all. After all, you're in India, bhai!
